Thanks again....as I take another deep breath!!! Raylene

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2009 09:33AM Raylene73 wrote: Barbe1958 LOL...I like the bra comment, definitely understood.  My pain is the exact same place.  This is where I'm stumped, prior to my daughter being born I had 5 kidney infections, always indicated by the back pain, never burning or other things, they finally dialated my urinary track and I was good to go until this past November, antibotics cleared it up and took away the pain in about 3 days, but now I don't have a positive urinary test...and to note, the first test in the doctors off never shows it they always have to send off for culture.  The pain is exactly the same place, I'm having a bone scan tomorrow and I have already had a CAT scan to rule out kidney stones.  What type of pain did you experience? I also agree, the support here is wonderful, I only joined last week but it is so wonderful there are some wonderful ladies out their and we are all trying to help each other!!! Raylene
Posts.Title: Kidneys? barbe1958 barbe1958

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2009 09:53AM Raylene73 wrote: My pain feels like pressure, it comes and goes and is definitely worse after I eat or especially after I drink.  My muscles tense up around that area too.  I don't have sharp pain, just pressure and advil does not help.  I can press around that area and there is not one exact spot, just pretty well the area right under my (old) bra line too...I did have reconstruction but I don't have to wear a bra I want to have the bone scan to know, but I'm scared half to death. Thanks again for your feedback!
